section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by temporary legislation that will expire on December 24, 2021.*
section.heading: Private right of action.

para.text: An employee who has suffered an adverse employment action prohibited pursuant to § 32-141.03 may bring a civil action in the Superior Court of the District of Columbia within one year after the alleged violation and, upon prevailing, shall be entitled to the following relief:
The payment of lost wages and benefits;
Equitable relief as may be appropriate; and
Punitive damages, if the employee's injuries were caused by the employer's wanton or reckless disregard for the safety of the affected employee.
An employee need not exhaust administrative remedies before bringing suit pursuant to this section.
